Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase I: Broadband High-Speed RF Spectrum Processor via Intelligent Adaptive Compressive Sensing and Parallel Processing FPGAs
Award.AbstractNarration:
This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project aims to study and demonstrate the feasibility of an innovative broadband, high-speed digital radio frequency (RF) spectrum processor for cognitive radio frequency and dynamic spectrum access network research and development via intelligent adaptive compressive sensing and parallel processing FPGAs. With recent advances in cognitive radio frequency technologies, there is a strong need for new wireless test, measurement and validation equipment with novel capabilities that are not available in current products. The research objective is to develop a spectrum processor that can perform real-time RF spectrum analysis on digitized data streams with ultra-wide bandwidth and has the capability of operating for cognitive radio frequency and dynamic spectrum access systems. Specifically, it takes advantage of the intelligent adaptive compressive sensing technology to significantly reduce the computational load while preserving the fidelity of spectrum analysis. Anticipated technical results include wide instantaneous bandwidth, integration of spectrum analysis and intelligent RF sensing, real time analysis capability, preliminary RF testing and demonstration.

The broader impact/commercial potential of this project is the development of a commercial broadband, high-speed digital radio frequency spectrum processor that will be used in academic, military, homeland security and industrial research laboratories worldwide with applications spanning the wireless communication, radio and television, GPS and other navigation systems. The success of this project will provide novel features to existing products in the market and has the commercial potential is substantial. The development of this technology has also important societal implications due to the wide range of scientific and industrial topics that this technology can be applied.

POR.DRECONTENT:
In this Small Business Innovation Research Program Phase I project, we have conducted the feasibility study of an innovative broadband, high-speed digital RF spectrum processor for cognitive radio network research and development via intelligent adaptive compressive sensing and parallel processing FPGA technologies. With recent advances in cognitive radio technologies, there is a strong demand for new wireless test, measurement and validation equipment with novel capabilities that are not available in current products. In this Phase I project, in addition to existing functions of spectrum analyzers, we have developed novel functionalities including: (1) operating and analyzing multiple non-contiguous spectrum bands over a broad bandwidth at user’s demand; (2) intelligent adaptive compressive sensing based spectrum analysis to provide flexible and adaptive spectrum resolution and sampling rate at given spectrum band based on user’s choice; (3) a comprehensive spectrum analysis solution to offer much more detailed information such as signal detection, mixed signal detection, RF parameter estimation, blind channel estimation, modulation detection, cyclostationary analysis, and so on. Finally, a software defined radio based demonstration of the basic functions of the intelligent RF spectrum processor has been completed to show the benefits and performance enhancements of the developed technologies. This Phase I project has successfully paved the path for future research and development of innovative software defined RF spectrum processor. 

 

Intellectual Merit

 

In this project, we have exploited recent advances in both the DSP domain and the hardware development domain to demonstrate the feasibility of a spectrum processor that can perform real-time RF spectrum analysis on digitized data streams with multi-GHz bandwidth and has the capability of operating over multiple non-contiguous bands. Specifically, it takes advantage of the intelligent adaptive compressive sensing technology to significantly reduce the computational load while preserving the fidelity of spectrum analysis. At the same time, its prototype design is based on newly developed powerful FPGAs with parallel processing capabilities to process the data in real-time. Furthermore, adaptive signal processing techniques have been employed to provide flexible and dynamic frequency resolution and sampling rate at user’s demand. A comprehensive suite of frequency domain and cyclostationarity domain analysis algorithms has been developed to offer rich information about the spectrum and signals existing in the band of interest.

 

Broader Impacts

 

This innovative broadband high-speed RF spectrum processor has significant broader impacts and commercial potential. With the system’s promising capability to monitor and analyze large bandwidth of RF spectrum in real-time, this technology and the ensuing product will significantly benefit the cognitive radio and dynamic spectrum access research and development. The technology also has the potential to percolate the existing vector spectrum analyzers in the market for all wireless system testing, measurement, and validation needs. The success of its ensuing commercialized product will provide a powerful tool to improve the speed, performance and efficiency of research and development of future wireless related systems, including wireless communication, radar systems, GPS and navigation systems.
